content.description: This route is very steep with clean falls, save your energy for the final move at the top!
content.protection: It takes cams,nuts and there's fixed nuts for top roping.
content.location: Starts at the right side of Giants Workshop wall at the base of the arete, climb the arete all the way to the top.

content.description:
This description is for the projectile finish, which is most commonly done because it is accessed by the fixed anchor. 

 Start on a ledge left of the right-facing corner at a vertical crack, and make the moves around the corner to access the stance on top of Intruders' initial corner. From the stance, follow the right-arching flake/roof system to a bulging face and the crux.
content.protection: Although this route usually sports a large selection of fixed protection that comes and goes, it can be protected very well if the fixed gear is not in place. It is more difficult to place the gear, obviously.
content.location: Left side of wall, left of obvious corner.

content.description:
Start up the vertical crack in the right-facing corner. At the end of the crack, traverse right below the roof until you are beneath the crack in the face. Pull over the roof and into the crack (crux) leading to the Projectile finish.

 "It would be hard if there were any hard moves"

 - Wolfgang Gullich
content.protection: Protects well with a single rack. As of 8/10/2019 there is a fixed nut at the intersection of Intruders and Projectile.

content.description: Giants Workshop is a secluded area between the Trapps and Skytop. It has three routes: Project X, 5.12b; Intruders, 5.13a; and Toys for Tots, 5.13b. The wall is steep for Gunks standards and provides great training.
